title: How to write a good love letter to my wife - Quora

response.answer_text: First answer the question of WHY (specifically) you feel the need to write such letter. The reason I ask is to make the letter more authentic. (More personal than the greeting card blurbs). Some of the obvious reasons may be: You’re feeling greater love for her because of something she has done, or is doing now, that makes you proud of her. You may be feeling a bit of guilt for some bad action you have done recently. You may have just recently come to your senses and realize you’re in a very happy place with her by your side. Start your letter elaborating on one of the above. For example. Case 1: Praise. “Honey, I’m so proud of you because (insert her action s or attributes that makes you proud)” Case 2: Acknowledgement: “Darling, I am so grateful that you (insert the act that she did to make you admire her even more). Your unselfish personality makes living with you an absolute joy. Case 3. Happiness: Dearest, I am just so happy to be by your side. You make my life worthwhile. Each day I look forward to just be sharing it with you. Case 4: Apologize: Apologize for a misdeed that you committed. Note: Even if you believe that you did not make a “misdeed” apologize anyway. As long as SHE believes you acted inappropriately, you must apologize. Example: “Honey, I am so very sorry about our misunderstanding concerning (insert topic). I realize I could have handled it better. Our relationship is just too important to let this matter fester any further. I love you dearly and hope you will accept my apology accordingly. (If she responds, either verbally or with a reply note, you can be sure you did the right thing.) Second Paragraph: (Tell her again how you feel. Use words that are positive and emits love images. Be general.) Example” I really want you to know how much I appreciate, trust, and respect you. You’re my rock that I can depend on and I’m so very happy with you. Your love is my bliss. Your Loving Husband, Eric Note to Eric: The letter need not be long. Actually, Should not be a long letter. Every sentence should be upbeat, positive, happy, loving, etc. Some things not to do: Do not include any defensive statements, no matter how subtle or ambiguous. Such as “You’re such a good Mother to our kids until it’s time for me to put them to bed.” Being defensive will only buy you a bigger doghouse. The most important advice I can give to any man about keeping a relationship in good standing is: learn to apologize. (I’ve been there done that) It is very important for two reasons. 1) It is one of the hardest actions that a man can do. The typical man would rather visit his dentist than to make an apology. 2) An “apology” has a different meaning to a woman than to a man. Women want to be recognized and appreciated. Apologizing to your woman lifts her self-esteem thereby lifting her love and respect for you. A man just wants to win the argument, with or without an apology. An analogy to this advice would be when a woman stokes a man’s ego by telling him how intelligent or gifted he is, when in fact she feels he is a dunderhead. Hmmmm. Note to self: Maybe write a book titled, “Lying Your Way to Love”

Hello Alisa Hope you are doing good. It's been a long time, we haven't talked. You are a very good friend of mine. You have helped me numerous times and you have always been there for me whenever I was in need. Well, you might be wondering why I am telling all these things to you. You know, you are the one who listens to me every time, no matter how boring or rubbish I am talking. That's it, I have something to tell you today, please listen to me and help me in the way you always do. One of my closest friends was asking me today if I am going to propose someone this Valentine's week? He was also asking me if I have ever fallen in love with a girl? I was about to tell him, "Yes!! There is a girl and she is very special for me, much more special than anyone else in this world. I really love her to the moon and back. But unfortunately, I haven't got any chance yet to tell her what my heart is saying for a long time. Most of the times, I am afraid, what if she would lose her temper after listening to me? Or what if, she would never talk to me again or she would do something even worse?" I want to tell you about that girl Alisa. You have always given me honest opinions and pieces of advice. Please help me in resolving this one indeed. I think that this would be the biggest and most important advice, which I am going to get from your side. Please tell me, if that girl would be the proper match for me or not. Alright, without wasting much time let me tell you, why did I fall in love with her? 1. I like her name really so much. Every time I call her by name, I get butterflies in my stomach. ( I know, if a girl is having a good name, it doesn't necessarily mean she would be having a good soul also. But anyways..) 2. She is beautiful. She is very beautiful. She is as beautiful a Barbie doll coming from heaven. Every time I look at her, I just lost myself in her divine beauty. Her eyes, as beautiful and glittering as a diamond in a huge mere. Her smile, so genuine that I always fall in love with her every time I look at it. The way she talks to me, the way she helps the needy... really makes me fall much more for her every time. 3. She is a girl with an amazing soul. She is not only externally beautiful but is the same from inside also. 4. I like the way she never gets angry from me, no matter how much rubbish I am talking to her. She is always kind to me (also to everyone) and understands all my feelings, my goods and bads. Alisa, I really can't express in words why do I love her? If would write 100000s of words, still I wouldn't be able to express 'how much she is special for me'. I just want to tell you, that I really love her so much. I would always care for her, I would never hurt her, I would never make her cry, I would fulfill all her wishes, I would never ever cheat on her. I want her to be my permanent, I want her to be with me till my last breath, I want her to become my better half. I just want to tell her, every time she's with me I feel like I am at the eleventh hour, or I am on the seventh heaven. Every time she breaks into laughter, I just feel my life to be beyond 'serene'. Every time she is hurt a bit, I cry my heart out. Alisa. That girl is much similar to you, that girl's name is as lively as yours. Oh God, let me not beat around the bush. I love you, Alisa. Will you be my valentine? Yours permanent Anant Vyas Share and upvote if you like Full post

Well in order to decide what we will write we needd to analyse the purpose of a love letter. It is all about the motivation. I guess writing a love letter can be done for many reasons…. To show deep appreciation for your soul mateTo demonstrate deep interest in a potential soulmate.To tempt confirmation of your partners feelings by declaring your own, because you became insecure.To confirm your feelings to a partner from distance because you are not there, and; to assure them you are still bonded despite this.There are probably many more reasons I missed but this I believe covers the popular motivations!! Once we know the reason we are writing it then we can decide on the format. Showing deep appreciation…. My format for this would probably be…. Intro… Decribing where I am, what time it is, my initial thoughts that motivated me to write. Main body Paragraph 1. … Confirmation of my emotions at this moment. How happy I have been because of knowing this person, how life was before, how it is now. Insert image…. Something depicting happiness. Main body Paragraph 2… My appreciation list of this person…. maybe ten things I love about them! Insert image.. something depicting “You rock” Main body paragraph 3…. A declaration of hope that this never ends. How empty life would be for me if it did. A list of the magical moments in my day when I usually find my partner and the joy those moments bring me. Insert image..Something depicting “magical world” Final declaration…. A statement of commitment and determination to make my partner happy forever. A declaration of complete devotion. An apology for my little faults and how it means nothing because my feelings are forever strong and forever will be. End…. Recently my elder brother had write a letter to his wife; you can write the letter in same manner. Dear Wife Ji, Today I woke up and all I could think of was you. I miss you when you aren't here. My favorite days are the ones we can wake up together. I love the days when we have time to drink coffee and talk. I love you for so many reasons. You are always there when I need you. Always a phone call away. When you call me in the middle of the day just to see how I am doing it melts my heart. I can't wait for you to get home. We laugh and joke about how much we spend time together. We always laugh when we are in sync. When we say the same thing at the same time. Even when we do something at the same time and exchange looks like really. We always have fun together. It may not always be easy but we end up laughing later. We don't celebrate most holidays or even participate in the commercial ones. This week will be amazing and a ton of fun. Thank you for always making me smile.

Be authentic. Use your own voice. Draw on the experiences you've shared that are unique to you. That matters more than the individual words or sounding polished and poetic.  Be vulnerable. It doesn't have to be long or sound like a greeting card. I had a partner who used to leave sticky notes around the house with simply "I <3 you" in random places that I'd find when I least expected it. I saved every one.

When I express myself, I try to be specific. So if I was going to write my husband a love letter, I’d mention something he said or did that meant a lot to me. I’d also explain why I appreciated it so much. You’re probably not at the old-married stage yet, so you might want to be more abstract. Cite the qualities you admire as well as the things he said or did. But to insert a cynical note here, keep in mind that letters stick around. You may not always feel the way you do now. Months (or even years) from now you don’t want him to wave your love letter and say something like “What do you mean, I never take anything seriously? You said here that you love my wacky sense of humor!” Or worse, if you break up, you don’t want him showing that letter to anyone else. Just a thought.

I would openly state all of the reasons why I love him, how much he makes me happy. I would tell him how much I respect and appreciate him. I would list all of his qualities and which one really made him stand out to me. Lastly, I would tell him that I can’t see my future without him, because he has made me the happiest woman in the world, and now I want to spend the rest of MY life making him the happiest man.

With a pen and paper. Start with Dear or Dearest ____, or something to that effect. And then just talk from the heart. Find things to be thankful for. Find things to acknowledge that person for. Relate what that person does for you, and how you are a better person for having him/her in your life. Just be open and honest, and enjoy each other, in writing.

Tell the person all the qualities you see in them, but they might not be aware of. Depict the role and importance they have in your life (without frightening them). Underline things that you have in common & you both like.

I would begin by pointing out the obvious like I was living on the edge & not much reason to live my life any other way until I met the one I would marry. Then tell em life in the fast lane lost all its appeal because I got to know & started to appreciate life & end it by saying another one bit the dust because of that little thing called love
